t: Jeremiah 12
Jeremiah’s Question

Righteous*pn are*i You, O Lord,*s when I plead with You; Yet*ld let me talk with You about Your*i judgments. Why*ld does the way of the wicked prosper? Why*ild are those happy who deal so treacherously?
You*ld have planted them, yes, they have taken root; They*ld grow, yes, they bear fruit. You*ld are*i near in their mouth But*ld far from their mind.
But*ln You, O Lord,*s know me; You*ld have seen me, And*ld You have tested my heart toward You. Pull*ld them out like sheep for the slaughter, And*ld prepare them for the day of slaughter.

How*ld long will the land mourn, And*ld the herbs of every field wither? The*ld beasts and birds are consumed, For*ld the wickedness of those who dwell there, Because*ld they said, “He will not see our final end.”
The Lord Answers Jeremiah

“If*pn you have run with the footmen, and they have wearied you, Then*ld how can you contend with horses? And*ld if*i in the land of peace, In*ild which*i you trusted, they*i wearied*i you,*i Then*ld how will you do in the floodplain of the Jordan?

For*ld even your brothers, the house of your father, Even*ld they have dealt treacherously with you; Yes,*ld they have called a multitude after you. Do*ld not believe them, Even*ld though they speak smooth words to you.
“I*ln have forsaken My house, I have left My heritage; I*ld have given the dearly beloved of My soul into the hand of her enemies.
My*ld heritage is to Me like a lion in the forest; It*ld cries out against Me; Therefore*ld I have hated it.
My*ld heritage is*i to Me like*i a speckled vulture; The*ld vultures all around are*i against her. Come,*ld assemble all the beasts of the field, Bring*ld them to devour!
“Many*ln rulers have destroyed My vineyard, They*ld have trodden My portion underfoot; They*ld have made My pleasant portion a desolate wilderness.
They*ld have made it desolate; Desolate,*ld it mourns to Me; The*ld whole land is made desolate, Because*ld no one takes it*i to heart.

The*ld plunderers have come On*ld all the desolate heights in the wilderness, For*ld the sword of the Lord*s shall devour From*ld one*i end of the land to the other*i end of the land; No*ld flesh shall have peace.
They*ld have sown wheat but reaped thorns; They*ld have put themselves to pain but*i do not profit. But*ld be ashamed of your harvest Because*ld of the fierce anger of the Lord.”*s

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “Against all My evil neighbors who touch the inheritance which I have caused My people Israel to inherit—behold, I will pluck them out of their land and pluck out the house of Judah from among them.
Then it shall be, after I have plucked them out, that I will return and have compassion on them and bring them back, everyone to his heritage and everyone to his land.

And it shall be, if they will learn carefully the ways of My people, to swear by My name, ‘As the Lord*s lives,’ as they taught My people to swear by Baal, then they shall be established in the midst of My people.
But if they do not obey, I will utterly pluck up and destroy that nation,” says the Lord.*s
